question: What is the maximum house price I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and existing monthly debts of $500?
true_answer: With an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500, you can afford a house priced up to $320,000, assuming a DTI of 35% and a 30-year mortgage at 3.5% interest.

steps.content: What is the maximum house price I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and existing monthly debts of $500?

Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for affordability calculation. 2) Verify assumptions with credit_agent. 3) Use calculator for financial calculations. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on affordability criteria and DTI benchmarks.
DTI should typically not exceed 36%. Also consider interest rates and loan terms.
Verifying credit policy terms and standard interest rates.
Standard interest rate is around 3.5% for 30-year fixed mortgages.
Calculating maximum affordable house price based on $80,000 income, $500 monthly debt, and 3.5% interest rate.
Calculated maximum house price is $320,000 with a 35% DTI.
Does this calculation consider property taxes and insurance?
Retrieving knowledge on inclusion of taxes and insurance in affordability.
Yes, estimation includes typical property taxes and insurance costs.
Review complete, all calculations and assumptions verified.
With an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500, you can afford a house priced up to $320,000, assuming a DTI of 35% and a 30-year mortgage at 3.5% interest.
